children: A 56-year-old woman is evaluated for recurrent epistaxis and obscure gastrointestinal bleeding.
Physical examination findings on her face are
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Examination of this patient's face and lips reveals the characteristic arteriovenous malformations of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (also known as Osler-Weber-Rendu disease). This autosomal dominant disorder is commonly associated with epistaxis, gastrointestinal bleeding, and iron deficiency anemia. Other systemic manifestations include arteriovenous malformations in the pulmonary, hepatic, and cerebral circulations.
